Package org.moeaframework.analysis.sensitivity

Class Analysis

java.lang.Object
org.moeaframework.util.CommandLineUtility
org.moeaframework.analysis.sensitivity.Analysis
public class Analysis extends CommandLineUtility
Command line utility for calculating the best, probability of attainment, efficiency and controllability metrics. These search control metrics are discussed in detail in [1].

Usage: java -cp "..." org.moeaframework.analysis.sensitivity.Analysis <options> <files>

Arguments:

-p, --parameterFile Location of the parameter configuration file (required)
-i, --parameters Location of the parameter sample file (required)
-m, --metric The metric index (or column) to use for the analysis (required). Indices are 0-based, so 0 indicates the first column in the input.
-v, --hypervolume The target or ideal hypervolume value, used to normalize the hypervolume in the analysis.
-o, --output Location where the output file containing the analysis results is saved. Of not given, the output is printed to the console.
-e, --efficiency Include the efficiency metric in the analysis results.
-b, --band The width of the NFE band. The efficiency metric groups samples with similar NFE together (i.e., those in the same band).
-c, --controllability Include the controllability metric in the analysis results.
-t, --threshold The performance threshold as a percentage when computing the attainment, efficiency, and controllability metrics.
<files> One or more files containing the metric results (i.e., the output from ResultFileEvaluator).

References:

  1. Hadka, D. and Reed, P. "Diagnostic Assessment of Search Controls and Failure Modes in Many-Objective Evolutionary Optimization." Evolutionary Computation.

      public org.apache.commons.cli.Options getOptions()
      Description copied from class: CommandLineUtility
